messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:24): wonders what Mellblomenator references
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:24): I mean, that _has_ to be a joke.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:29): Anyone able to give me a hand with writing a security considerations section?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:29): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Seems quite likely that it's referring to the same person as http://www.mellblom.us/blog/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:29): particularly since the photo on that site indicates the person works for Google
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:30): and the latest blog post talks about the Mellblom Browser, mere days before the similar text was inserted into HTML5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:41): damn, you're good
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (21:59): wonders who 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e is referring to...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:02): philip
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:05): used his incredible skills to type Mellblom into Live Search and find that page
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:06): and you actually found it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:06): impressive
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:07): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: How do you keep spam off whatwg?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:07): I used my supersight abilities to look through plastic and liquid crystals to see the first search result
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:07): http://lastweekinhtml5.blogspot.com/2009/03/hair-in-gait.html
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:07): oh dear‚Ä¶

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I mean the <email/> list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:08): only subscribers can post
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:09): That's all?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:11): yup
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:12): hang on, are there multiple Philip Taylors?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:12): yes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:12): two
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:12): both of which have used at least two different e-mail addresses
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:12): wow, that explains a lot!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:12): possibly three
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:12): lol
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:12): Three
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:15): I'm pretty sure I've used at least three addresses

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:19): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: One has "Philip TAYLOR" in the From header and isn't on IRC; the other has "Philip Taylor" in the From header and is ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c on Freenode and Philip on irc.w3.org
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:22): I'm the one who's on IRC
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:23): they are otherwise undistinguishable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:23): ducks
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:24): hopes that substitution was meant to apply to the last-but-one line
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:25): yes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:25): you can't apply substitutions to what i'm doing, silly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:25): ducks again
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:29): btw 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427, re your mail, things out of the document shouldn't delay the event
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:29): i'll make it clearer at some point
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:30): boris says this matters for existing content
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:30): image preloading stuff
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:30): really?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:30): wow
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:30): good to know
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:30): well then i guess it's up to you
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:31): i can go either way
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:31): per spec right now technically they do even out of their doc, though i should make it clearer either way
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (22:37): I think video should be consistent with images
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:38): right-o

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:42): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I think you calculated x wrongly
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:42): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Nah, that's given.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:43): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Oh, maybe you got y wrong then
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:43): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: There is no y.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:43): This is question five, BTW.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:44): Hmm, beats me
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:44): It would work if I got ln 2/3 + ln 2/3 and not ln 2/3 + ln 3/2

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:05): "A solid is formed by rotating the curve $y = e^{-2x}$ between $x = 0$ and $x = 1$ through $360\circ$ about the $x$-axis. Calculate the volume of the solid that is formed."
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:05): Why would I ever want to be able to do this?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:05): :P
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:08): I've got one of those at home
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:08): makes a great toilet plunger
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:09): And Boris realizes I'm being dumb on /.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:09): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: So what's its volume?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:09): (Or rather: why would I care?)
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:10): so you know how much rubber to buy to make it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:10): But then surely I care about the circumference at the bottom and not the volume?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:12): concludes that it has no use and ignores the question
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:18): why is knowing the volume not useful?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:18): for the case 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 gave?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:18): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Isn't it just something like integral(pi*y^2, dx)?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:18): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Well, there's some equation, yeah

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: What I mean is "Isn't it exactly integral(pi*y^2, dx)? (except if that's wrong then it's just because I've not spent much time thinking about it, not because I'm stupid, honest)"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:20): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: The answer to which is "I don't know because I can't be bothered looking it up or thinking about it."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:21): is RT retweet?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I think it is.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Yeah
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:21): today's the first time I've seen that too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:21): Sorry 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, forgive me :P

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:22): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: You don't need to think about it, it's just obvious that the volume is the sum of lots of discs, and sums are integrals, and discs have volume pi*r^2*dx, and that's about it :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:23): and the mere existence of a question is enough reason to attempt to solve it

a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (23:56): My read is that the discussion on the proposed Excerpt License is simply going to rediscover the original use cases that we already sent, after a lot of email.

a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (23:57): It occurs to me that if you happened to agree with the last two paragraphs of this: <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2009Mar/0144.html> and were to say so, it might (just might) shorten the process a bit.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:57): that would certainly follow past patterns of public-html e-mail
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (23:57): Of course, if you disagree, feel free to say that also
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:58): seems reasonable to me, which is why i didn't post again to the list after saying my bit about license proliferation :-)

a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (23:59): I'm just suggesting that you do consider posting again.  You're call.  I agree with you about license proliferation, but given the brokenness of not having a dialog, it unfortunately could be seen as us raising the goal posts.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: i disagree with your earlier point (though i don't care enough to say so on the list), in that i think that the change you talk about happened in 2004
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): and the w3c license is really a change back to the old ways
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): er

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): &lt 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e> a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: i disagree with your earlier point (though i don't care enough to say so on the list), in that i think that the change you talk about happened in 2004
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): &lt 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e> and the w3c license is really a change back to the old ways
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:01): but if you want me to say +1 then i'm happy to do so
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:01): it might set up a bad precedent, though :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:01): (public-html had a bad problem with people +1'ing each other historically)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:09): i really wish dragging the w3c into modernity wasn't so painful a process
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:12): Well, you should be less demanding, and you should just be a post-modernist.
